recipes.title: Italian Lasagna
instructions: Cook beef, sausage, onion, and garlic over medium-high heat until no pink remains; drain fat.
Stir in tomato sauce, sugar, and italian seasoning; simmer 5 minutes.
In a bowl combine parmesan, cottage cheese, and egg until creamy.
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Create 3 layers, starting with meat sauce, then lasagna noodles, then 1/3 cheese mixture. Top with mozzarella.
Cover with foil and bake 45 minutes. Remove foil and bake another 15 minutes.

recipes.title: Spinach Pesto Lasagna
instructions: Mix flour and salt; crack eggs in the center and knead about 8 minutes until soft but not sticky, adding flour as needed.
Rest dough 30 minutes, cut into portions, roll or run through a pasta maker until thin, then boil 2-3 minutes and set aside.
Wilt spinach; combine with cottage cheese, pesto, parsley, parmesan, salt, and pepper.
Preheat oven to 400°F and grease an 11x17 pan.
Layer noodles, 1/3 cheese mixture, spinach, and zucchini; repeat twice. Top with remaining mozzarella.
Cover with foil and bake 45 minutes. Remove foil and bake 15 minutes more.

recipes.title: Honey Garlic Ribs
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Separate ribs into individual pieces.
Toss ribs with honey, spices, sugars, pepper, onion, and BBQ sauce until well coated.
Spread on a foil-lined pan, cover lightly with foil.
Bake about 1 hour, flipping occasionally until caramelized and tender.

recipes.title: Garlic Herb Chicken Roast
instructions: Preheat oven to 430°F and line a baking tray with foil.
Stir together olive oil, melted butter, wine, and juice from half a lemon.
Mix plenty of salt, pepper, and garlic seasoning; rub inside and outside of the chicken.
Mince half the garlic and rub under the skin and over the bird; sprinkle with chopped parsley.
Stuff cavity with remaining garlic cloves, the other lemon half, rosemary, and thyme sprigs.
Roast 1 hour 15 minutes, basting halfway; internal temp should reach 165°F. Baste once more and rest 10 minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Spinach Stuffed Salmon
instructions: Pat salmon dry; season both sides with salt, pepper, and a little olive oil.
Warm spinach in a pan until soft; mix with cream cheese, parmesan, and garlic.
Slice salmon lengthwise, cutting a slit 3/4 of the way through. Stuff with spinach mixture.
Sear salmon presentation side down in oil over medium-high heat until golden, about 5 minutes.
Flip, add butter and lemon juice, and baste until salmon reaches about 130°F. Finish with a squeeze of lemon and serve.

recipes.title: Baked Ziti
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Spread 1/2 cup marinara on the bottom of a 9x13 dish.
Combine ricotta, garlic, lemon zest, oregano, salt, and pepper in a bowl.
Cook ziti according to package; drain.
Sauté spinach until wilted, cool, and chop.
Toss pasta with sauce mixture, sliced meatballs, and spinach; season.
Add half the pasta to the pan, dollop ricotta mixture, then add remaining pasta. Top with mozzarella and parmesan.
Bake 16-22 minutes until bubbly; garnish with basil or parsley.

recipes.title: Scalloped Potatoes
instructions: Peel and slice potatoes 1/8-1/4 inch thick; keep in water.
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Melt butter; cook onion and garlic about 3 minutes.
Stir in flour and cook 2 minutes, then reduce heat.
Whisk milk and broth together; add to pan with salt and pepper and bring to a boil for 1 minute.
Grease a 9x9 dish. Layer 1/3 potatoes, season, then 1/3 sauce; repeat for 3 layers.
Cover with foil and bake 45 minutes; uncover and bake another 35-45 minutes. Rest 15 minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Chicken Pesto Pasta
instructions: Cook pasta and broccoli together in boiling water until pasta is al dente; drain.
Sauté onion in oil until caramelized; add garlic and sliced chicken, season with salt and pepper.
Stir in cream and parmesan; let simmer briefly.
Fold in pasta and broccoli, then mix in pesto. Remove from heat and finish with parmesan or green onions.

recipes.title: Kale Pesto Pasta
instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions; reserve.
In butter, wilt kale on medium heat, then cook onion until caramelized; add garlic.
Blend kale, onion, garlic, pesto, and a splash of cream if desired until smooth.
Return sauce to pan, add pasta, mozzarella, and parmesan; stir on low heat for a minute.
Garnish with toasted slivered almonds, green onion, and extra parmesan.

recipes.title: Pad Thai
instructions: Cook Pad Thai noodles per package; set aside.
Pan-fry chicken in a little olive oil until cooked through; stir in garlic.
Push chicken aside, scramble eggs in the pan until just set.
Add noodles and toss together.
Whisk sauce ingredients and pour over noodles; add onions and peanuts and stir to coat.
Simmer a few minutes until sauce reduces and clings. Serve with extra peanuts, green onion, and lemon wedges.

recipes.title: Korean Ground Beef with Greek Salad
instructions: Cook ground beef and garlic over medium heat, breaking into crumbles, until no longer pink; drain grease.
Whisk brown sugar, soy sauce, sesame oil, ginger, paprika, and pepper; pour over beef and simmer 1-2 minutes.
Serve over hot rice. Garnish with green onions, sesame seeds, and toasted almonds. Add cucumber, tomato, and avocado with feta on top if desired.

recipes.title: Doubles
instructions: Soak chickpeas overnight with baking soda; drain and rinse well.
In a pot add water, chickpeas, salt, and a bit more baking soda; bring to a boil and skim.
Cook until tender, about 1 hour; add garlic and turmeric and stir without mashing.
Cook 15-20 minutes more, stirring until thickened.
Adjust salt and finish with roasted cumin.

recipes.title: Cheese Wontons
instructions: Mix cream cheese, sugar, onion powder, and garlic powder until smooth.
Separate wonton skins and place equal filling in the center of each.
Preheat oil in a deep pan or Dutch oven to about 350°F.
Brush edges with beaten egg and seal the wontons.
Fry 5-6 at a time for 2-3 minutes until golden; drain and serve warm.

recipes.title: Frickles
instructions: Heat oil to about 360°F.
Whisk all batter ingredients together.
Pat pickle slices dry; spread breadcrumbs on a plate.
Dip pickles in batter, then breadcrumbs; let sit briefly.
Fry in small batches 3-4 minutes until brown and crispy. Serve with ranch.

recipes.title: Smoked Brisket Sandwich
instructions: Layer brisket, pickles, onion, tomato, and mayo on a brioche bun; season with salt and pepper.
Toast assembled sandwich for about 1 minute and serve warm.

recipes.title: Mini Quiches
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Cut puff pastry into 12 pieces and press into a muffin tray.
Prebake shells 5 minutes until golden and puffed.
Scramble eggs, then mix in bacon, broccoli, onion, and just under half the cheese.
Fill shells with egg mixture and top with remaining cheese.
Bake until cheese is melted and egg is set.

recipes.title: Ham and Cheese Sliders
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F and lightly butter a pan.
Slice connected brioche buns in half and place in pan; spread mayo.
Layer with ham and cheese; close buns.
Mix melted butter, Worcestershire, garlic powder, Dijon, salt, and pepper; brush over tops and sprinkle seeds.
Bake about 10 minutes until hot and melty; slice while warm and serve.

recipes.title: Sourdough Crackers
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Mix discard, flour, melted butter, and salt into a dough.
Roll very thin with pasta maker or rolling pin (nearly see-through).
Place on baking sheet, brush with oil, cut to cracker size, bake ~15 minutes, turning halfway; watch closely to avoid burning.

recipes.title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Barely melt butter so it is soft but not hot.
Mix butter with sugars until combined.
Stir in vanilla and egg until smooth.
Add flour, baking soda, and salt; mix just until dough forms, adding a little flour if needed.
Fold in chocolate chips, roll into 12-15 large balls, and place on a baking sheet.
Bake about 10 minutes until just set and barely cooked on top.

recipes.title: Ginger Cookies
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Mix all ingredients together in order until dough forms.
Roll into balls and coat in sugar.
Bake 8-10 minutes until they just start cracking and still look slightly underdone.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Scones
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
In a large bowl mix flour, sugar, spices, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Cut in cold butter until the mixture is crumbly.
Add pumpkin purée, milk, egg, and vanilla; mix until a soft sticky dough forms.
Lightly flour a surface and briefly knead until it holds together; pat into a 1-inch disc and cut into 8 wedges.
Bake 14-16 minutes; cool before glazing.
Mix powdered sugar with milk for a white glaze; mix remaining sugar, milk, vanilla, and spices for a second drizzle; glaze scones.

recipes.title: Peach Crumble Bars
instructions: Whisk sugar, flour, baking powder, salt, and cinnamon.
Cut in cold butter until crumbly, then mix in egg so crumbs hold together.
Press slightly over half the crumbs into the pan as the crust.
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Mix sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, and lemon juice; toss with peaches.
Pour peach mixture over crust, top with remaining crumbs, and bake 50-55 minutes until golden.
Whisk powdered sugar, almond extract, and milk; drizzle over cooled bars.

recipes.title: Mini Cinnamon Cheesecakes
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F; line a cupcake pan with 12 liners.
Combine crust ingredients and divide among liners; press down and bake 5 minutes. Reduce oven to 300°F.
Beat cream cheese, sugar, flour, and cinnamon. On low, mix in sour cream and vanilla, then beat in eggs one at a time.
Layer cheesecake batter and cinnamon sugar in liners, ending with cinnamon sugar (3 layers each).
Bake 15 minutes; turn oven off and let sit 7 minutes before removing to cool.
Mix frosting ingredients and pipe onto cooled cheesecakes. Serve warm or chilled.

recipes.title: Cookie Dough Ice Cream Cake
instructions: Bake brownie mix in a 9-inch springform pan; cool completely.
For cookie dough balls, cream butter and brown sugar; mix in vanilla, milk, and flour, then chocolate chips. Roll tiny balls and chill.
Spread half the ice cream over brownie base.
Mix Oreo crumbs with melted butter; sprinkle over ice cream layer.
Make fudge by heating cream to a boil, pouring over chocolate chips, maple syrup, and vanilla; whisk smooth, cool slightly, and pour over crumbs. Freeze 1-2 hours.
Spread remaining ice cream, folding in cookie dough balls. Decorate with extra dough balls and whipped cream. Freeze overnight before serving.

recipes.title: Fake Sourdough
instructions: Mix dry ingredients together.
Add about half the water and stir; add more as needed until a shaggy dough forms.
Cover and let rest in a warm spot for at least 10 hours.
Preheat oven to 400°F.
Transfer dough to an oven-safe dish with a lid.
Bake 30 minutes covered, then 15 more minutes uncovered until browned.

recipes.title: Focaccia
instructions: Whisk together dry ingredients; add warm water and form a rough sticky dough ball.
Rub dough with olive oil, cover with a damp towel, and refrigerate overnight.
Oil a baking dish, place dough on it, and use a fork to loosen from the bowl.
Cover with a damp towel and rest 3-4 hours.
Preheat oven to 425°F.
Lightly oil hands and dough; dimple and stretch to fill the pan. Sprinkle with sea salt and rosemary.
Bake 25-30 minutes; cool on a rack for about 10 minutes.

recipes.title: Coconut Cream Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F; bake pie crust 10 minutes with pie weights or rice.
In a saucepan whisk sugar, cornstarch, and salt to remove clumps. Add coconut milk and half-and-half; whisk in egg yolks until smooth.
Cook over medium heat, whisking constantly, until thickened (about 7 minutes).
If needed, strain for smoothness; stir in vanilla and coconut extracts.
Pour warm filling into baked crust and refrigerate 4 hours or overnight.
Top with whipped cream and toasted coconut before serving.

recipes.title: Sticky Toffee Pudding
instructions: Make sauce: simmer brown sugar, butter, syrup, and 1 cup cream 5 minutes; cook on medium-low, stirring, until deep amber (30-35 minutes).
Whisk in remaining 3/4 cup cream until smooth; strain sauce.
Simmer dates with water until nearly absorbed (6-8 minutes); puree in food processor until mostly smooth.
Preheat oven to 350°F; butter six 6-oz ramekins on a tray.
Whisk flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Beat brown sugar and softened butter until fluffy; beat in egg, vanilla, then date puree. Mix in dry ingredients just to combine.
Divide batter into ramekins 6 and bake 20-25 minutes until a toothpick is clean.
Remove cake from ramekins and cut in half, and 1  spoon of sauce into each ramekin, add bottom of cake, spoon more sauce, top with remaining cake and more sauce.
Bake ramekins 10-15 minutes until sauce bubbles at edges. Cool slightly; serve warm with ice cream.
